get.description: This API call is used to retrieve a list of payment requests and their details

parameters.description: The ID of the store to retrieve requests associated with
parameters.name: store_id

parameters.description: The ID of the terminal to retrieve requests associated with
parameters.name: terminal_id

parameters.description: The current status of the request. Must be a valid enum value. If you omit this parameter, the returned list will include all statuses
parameters.name: status

parameters.description: The transaction type of the request. Must be a valid enum value
parameters.name: transaction_type

parameters.description: The start date using the ISO 8601 format
parameters.name: start_date_time

parameters.description: The end date using the ISO 8601 format
parameters.name: end_date_time

parameters.description: The maximum number of results to be returned
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The (zero-based) offset of the first record in the collection to return
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: Sort the result set in ascending (ASC) or descending (DESC) order based on the date the payment request is created
parameters.name: sort

authorisation.description:
Given a valid access token, you can now use a Bearer Token to authenticate your requests.
To do so you have to preface your access token with Bearer and send it in the HTTP Authorization header.
It should look something like this: `Authorization: Bearer <ACCESS_TOKEN>`
